}} In enzymology, a '6-pyruvoyltetrahydropterin synthase' ('PTPS') () is an
enzyme that catalyzes the following chemical reaction:

:6-[(1S,2R)-1,2-dihydroxy-3-triphosphooxypropyl]-7,8-dihydropterin
: \rightleftharpoons 6-pyruvoyl-5,6,7,8-tetrahydropterin +
:triphosphate

Hence, this enzyme has one substrate, 6-[(1S,2R)-1,2-dihydroxy-3-triphosphooxypropyl]-7,8-
dihydropterin, and two products, 6-pyruvoyl-5,6,7,8-tetrahydropterin and
triphosphate.

This enzyme belongs to the family of lyases, to be specific, those carbon-oxygen
lyases acting on phosphates. The systematic name of this enzyme class is '6-[(1S,2R)-1,2-dihydroxy-3-triphosphooxypropyl]-7,8-
dihydropterin triphosphate-lyase (6-pyruvoyl-5,6,7,8-tetrahydropterin-forming)'.
Other names in common use include '2-amino-4-oxo-6-[(1S,2R)-1,2-dihydroxy-3-triphosphooxypropyl]-7,8-
', and 'dihydroxypteridine triphosphate lyase'. This enzyme participates in
tetrahydrobiopterin biosynthesis.
